pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.3.pli: Tā akkhamā honti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṁ duruttānaṁ durāgatānaṁ vacanapathānaṁ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.3.en: They were unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.11.pli: Ūnadvādasavassā, bhikkhave, gihigatā akkhamā hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṁ duruttānaṁ durāgatānaṁ vacanapathānaṁ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.11.en: A married girl less than twelve years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.13.pli: Dvādasavassāva kho, bhikkhave, gihigatā khamā hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṁ duruttānaṁ durāgatānaṁ vacanapathānaṁ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.13.en: But a married girl who is twelve years old is able to endure these things.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.3.pli: Tā akkhamā honti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṁ duruttānaṁ durāgatānaṁ vacanapathānaṁ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.3.en: They were unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.11.pli: Ūnavīsativassā, bhikkhave, kumāribhūtā akkhamā hoti sītassa uṇhassa …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.11.en: An unmarried girl less than twenty years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.13.pli: Vīsativassāva kho, bhikkhave, kumāribhūtā khamā hoti sītassa uṇhassa …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.13.en: But an unmarried girl who is twenty years old is able to endure these things.

an3.49:1.3.pli: Anuppannānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ anuppādāya ātappaṁ karaṇīyaṁ, anuppannānaṁ kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ uppādāya ātappaṁ karaṇīyaṁ, uppannānaṁ sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ adhivāsanāya ātappaṁ karaṇīyaṁ.
an3.49:1.3.en: You should be keen to prevent bad, unskillful qualities from arising. You should be keen to give rise to skillful qualities. And you should be keen to endure physical pain—sharp, severe, acute, unpleasant, disagreeable, life-threatening.

an3.49:2.1.pli: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anuppannānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ anuppādāya ātappaṁ karoti, anuppannānaṁ kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ uppādāya ātappaṁ karoti, uppannānaṁ sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ adhivāsanāya ātappaṁ karoti.
an3.49:2.1.en: It’s a mendicant who is keen to prevent bad, unskillful qualities from arising. They’re keen to give rise to skillful qualities. And they’re keen to endure physical pain—sharp, severe, acute, unpleasant, disagreeable, life-threatening.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 3
5. The Lesser Chapter
49. Keen

an7.36:1.3.pli: Duddadaṁ dadāti, dukkaraṁ karoti, dukkhamaṁ khamati, guyhamassa āvi karoti, guyhamassa pariguhati, āpadāsu na jahati, khīṇena nātimaññati.
an7.36:1.3.en: They give what is hard to give. They do what is hard to do. They endure what is hard to endure. They reveal their secrets to you. They keep your secrets. They don’t abandon you in times of trouble. They don’t look down on you in times of loss.

an7.36:2.4.en: and with things hard to endure.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.48.pli: Ūnakavīsativasso, bhikkhave, puggalo akkhamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṁ duruttānaṁ durāgatānaṁ vacanapathānaṁ uppannānaṁ sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ anadhivāsakajātiko hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.48.en: A person who is less than twenty years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, and the burning sun; creeping animals and insects; and rude and unwelcome speech. And they are unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.49.pli: Vīsativassova kho, bhikkhave, puggalo khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.49.en: But a person who’s twenty years old is able to endure these things.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.10.4.pli: “Nāvuso, sakkā yena vā tena vā adhivāsetun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.10.4.en: “It’s not possible for just anyone to endure this.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.10.10.en: “It’s not possible for an ordinary person to endure this.”

pli-tv-kd1:49.6.1.pli: Ūnavīsativasso, bhikkhave, puggalo akkhamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṁ duruttānaṁ durāgatānaṁ vacanapathānaṁ uppannānaṁ sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ anadhivāsakajātiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.6.1.en: A person who’s less than twenty years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, and the burning sun; creeping animals and insects; and rude and unwelcome speech. And he’s unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.

pli-tv-kd1:49.6.2.pli: Vīsativassova kho, bhikkhave, puggalo khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṁ duruttānaṁ durāgatānaṁ vacanapathānaṁ, uppannānaṁ sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ adhivāsakajātiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.6.2.en: But a person who’s twenty years old is able to endure these things.
